description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} and aware of it must succeed on a [[/save wis 20 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} uses one of the following breath weapons.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales &Reference[lightning]{lightning} in a 120-foot &Reference[line]{line} that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that &Reference[line]{line} must make a [[/save dex 23 format=long]], taking [[/damage 16d10 type=lightning average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales repulsion energy in a 30-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save str 23 format=long]]. On a failed save, the creature is pushed 60 feet away from the &Reference[dragon]{dragon}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} magically polymorphs into a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} or &Reference[beast]{beast} that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and &Reference[int]{Intelligence}, &Reference[wis]{Wisdom}, and &Reference[cha]{Charisma} scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

  • The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} creates fog as though it had cast the fog cloud spell. The fog lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round.
  • A thunderclap originates at a point the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature within a 20-foot radius centered on that point must make a [[/save con 15 format=long]] or take [[/damage 1d10 type=thunder average=true]] damage and be &Reference[deafened]{deafened} until the end of its next turn.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regional Effects

The region containing a legendary bronze dragon’s lair is warped by the dragon’s magic.

  • Once per day, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can alter the weather in a 6-mile radius centered on its lair. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} doesn’t need to be outdoors; otherwise the effect is identical to the control weather spell.
  • Underwater plants within 6 miles of the dragon’s lair take on dazzlingly brilliant hues.
  • Within its lair, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can set illusory sounds, such as soft music and strange echoes, so that they can be heard in various parts of the lair.

If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies, changed weather reverts to normal, as described in the spell, and the other effects fade in 1d10 days.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A Bronze Dragon’s Lair

A bronze &Reference[dragon]{dragon} lairs in coastal caves. It might salvage a wrecked ship, reconstruct it within the confines of its lair, and use it as a treasure vault or nest for its eggs.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Detect. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

Tail Attack. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a tail attack.

Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 24 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 9 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 24 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 9 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Amphibious. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
